channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Schur multiplier of $\mathrm{SL}_2$ over finite commutative rings
item.description: arXiv:2510.03946v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we investigate the Schur multiplier of the special linear group $\mathrm{SL}_2(A)$ over finite commutative local rings $A$. We prove that the Schur multiplier of these groups is isomorphic to the $K$-group $K_2(A)$ whenever the residue field $A/\mathfrak{m}_A$ has odd characteristic and satisfies $|A/\mathfrak{m}_A| \neq 3,5,9$. As an application, we show that if $A$ is either the Galois ring $\mathrm{GR}(p^l,m)$ or the quasi-Galois ring $A(p^m,n)$ with residue field of odd characteristic and $|A/\mathfrak{m}_A| \neq 3,5,9$, then the Schur multiplier of $\mathrm{SL}_2(A)$ is trivial.
item.dc:creator: Behrooz Mirzaii, Abraham Rojas Vega

item.title: On Milnor $K$-theory in the imperfect residue case and applications to period-index problems
item.description: arXiv:2510.03603v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Given a $(0,p)$-mixed characteristic complete discrete valued field $\mathcal{K}$ we define a class of finite field extensions called pseudo-perfect extensions such that the natural restriction map on the mod-$p$ Milnor $K$-groups is trivial for all $p\neq 2$. This implies that pseudo-perfect extensions split every element in $H^i(\mathcal{K},\mu_p^{\otimes i-1})$ yielding period-index bounds for Brauer classes as well as higher cohomology classes of $\mathcal{K}$. As a corollary, we prove a conjecture of Bhaskhar-Haase that the Brauer $p$-dimension of $\mathcal{K}$ is upper bounded by $n+1$ where $n$ is the $p$-rank of the residue field. When $\mathcal{K}$ is the fraction field of a complete regular ring, we show that any $p$-torsion element in $Br(\mathcal{K})$ that is nicely ramified is split by a pseudo-perfect extension yielding a bound on its index. We then use patching techniques of Harbater, Hartmann and Krashen to show that the Brauer $p$-dimension of semi-global fields of residual characteristic $p$ is at most $n+2$. This bound is sharper than previously known in the work of Parimala-Suresh.
item.dc:creator: Srinivasan Srimathy

item.title: Shifted Symplectic Geometry by Examples
item.description: arXiv:2510.04625v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: These notes are intended to be an introduction to shifted symplectic geometry, targeted to Poisson geometers with a serious background in homological algebra. They are extracted from a mini-course given by the first author at the Poisson 2024 summer school that took place at the Accademia Pontaniana in Napoli.
item.dc:creator: Damien Calaque, Stefano Ronchi

item.title: Wakamatsu tilting subcategories and weak support tau-tilting subcategories in recollements
item.description: arXiv:2409.07026v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article, we prove that if (A, B, C) is a recollement of abelian categories, then Wakamatsu tilting (resp. weak support tau-tilting) subcategories in A and C can induce Wakamatsu tilting (resp. weak support tau-tilting) subcategories in B, and the converses hold under natural assumptions. As an application, we mainly consider the relationship of tau-cotorsion torsion triples in (A, B, C).
item.dc:creator: Yongduo Wang, Hongyang Luo, Yu-Zhe Liu, Jian He, Dejun Wu

item.title: Small scale index theory, scalar curvature, and Gromov's simplicial norms
item.description: arXiv:2508.14791v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article, we study the topological complexity of manifolds with a lower scalar curvature bound. We introduce a small scale index theorem to establish an upper bound for Gromov's simplicial norm of the Poincar\'e dual of the A-hat class for manifolds with spin universal covering. The bound depends on a scalar curvature lower bound, injectivity radius, and volume. This result can be viewed both as a generalization of Lichnerowicz vanishing theorem and as a scalar curvature analogue to Cheeger finiteness theorem.
item.dc:creator: Qiaochu Ma, Guoliang Yu
